paper_abstract: We consider involutory antimorphisms theta of a free monoid A* and their fixed points, called theta-palindromes or pseudopalindromes. A theta-palindrome reduces to a usual palindrome when theta is the reversal operator. For any word w is an element of A* the right (resp. left) theta-palindrome closure of w is the shortest V-palindrome having w as a prefix (resp. suffix). We prove some results relating V-palindrome closure operators with periodicity and conjugacy, and derive some interesting closure properties for the languages of finite Sturmian and episturmian words. In particular, a finite word w is Sturmian if and only if both its palindromic closures are so. Moreover, in such a case, both the palindromic closures of w share the same minimal period of w. A new characterization of finite Sturmian words follows, in terms of periodicity and special factors of their palindromic closures. Some weaker results can be extended to the episturmian case. By using the right theta-palindrome closure, we extend the construction of standard episturmian words via directive words. In this way one obtains a family of infinite words, called theta-standard words, which are morphic images of episturmian words, as well as a wider family of infinite words including the Thue-Morse word on two symbols. paper_title: Pseudopalindrome closure operators in free monoids
